syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Chemistry 9701

learning_objectives.description: recall the reactions (reagents and conditions) by which primary and secondary amines are produced: (a) reaction of halogenoalkanes with NH₃ in ethanol heated under pressure (b) reaction of halogenoalkanes with primary amines in ethanol, heated in a sealed tube/under pressure (c) the reduction of amides with LiAlH₄ (d) the reduction of nitriles with LiAlH₄ or H₂/Ni
describe the condensation reaction of ammonia or an amine with an acyl chloride at room temperature to give an amide
describe and explain the basicity of aqueous solutions of amines
